body.p: This is a work of fiction. Any names, characters, places, events, incidents, or items depicted in the series have no relation to the real world.

cbml:caption.p: The biggest corporation in South Korea, with nearly 300 trillion won* in annual revenue and 30 trillion won* in net profit alone.
It is an absolute giant across various business sectors, including automotive, shipbuilding, telecommunications, heavy industry, chemicals, distribution, fashion, and food production.
Suffice to say, Soonyang has more than substantial influence in every single industry in South Korea.

cbml:panel.note: Introduction of male lead and his connection to Soonyang Corporation

cbml:caption.p: When I, a country boy that went to a rural college, was accepted by this incredibly admired corporation...
... My father invited all of his relatives over and held a feast for me.
When I was promoted to the office of future strategy planning, the nucleus of Soonyang Corp, I was so exhilarated that I thought my heart was going to explode.
However, I was soon disappointed by my roles as the "cleaner" of the office.

cbml:panel.note: Details of male lead's duties as a "cleaner" for Soonyang Corporation

cbml:caption.p: The cleaner's job was to clean up after every mess, from small and tedious to big and even dirty.
But I didn't stop there. I studied english, and analyzed many business proposals in my spare time.
I was absolutely determined to become an asset to the company
My dedication finally paid off in due time. I was recognized for the value I offered.

cbml:panel.note: Explanation of Soonyang's "royal family" and time skip into the male lead's future with the Corporation

cbml:caption.p: Everyone in the *Royal Family of the Corporate Empire of Soonyang eventually knew who I was.

cbml:panel.note: *Most large conglomerates in South Korea are family-owned

cbml:caption.p: I was the first one they looked for, in times of need.
Especially when they needed certain inconveniences, from small to big, to be taken care of, I, Hyeonwoo Yoon, was the person they called for.
... I became perhaps the only outsider that knew about the royal family from the inside out...
... Indicating I had earned their trust.
